block.p: Terminal Tastings

There will be a chance to taste the fare of the 18 food stalls and cafes on the lower concourse of Grand Central Terminal tomorrow from 3 to 9 p.m. and on Friday and Saturday from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Tickets, $10 each and good for a sample from each place, will be sold, cash only, at a booth on the lower level.
Terminal Tastings

Scotch and Cigars

Dozens of brands of Scotch will be poured at a tasting sponsored by the Scotch Malt Whiskey Society tomorrow from 7 to 9 p.m. at the Sheraton New York hotel, 53rd Street and Seventh Avenue. A buffet and cigars will also be available. Tickets are $65 for members of the society, $75 for nonmembers: (800) 990-1991.
On Nov. 1, Malt Advocate magazine will hold a tasting of more than 200 whiskies from 6:30 to 10 p.m. at the Marriott Marquis, 45th Street and Broadway. Tickets are $85: (800) 610-6258.
Design by Women as Chefs

A program about women and design will focus on chefs on Friday from 12:30 to 5:45 p.m. at the Bard Graduate Center, 38 West 86th Street. It will start with a lecture at the center and continue with visits to Verbena, the Lobster Club and Felidia with talks by the chefs, all of them women, about their culinary styles. A wine reception will be held at Felidia. The cost is $150, or $100 for students and those over 65: (212) 501-3011.
A Taste of Provence

The French Government Tourist Office is holding a Provencal market, with food for sale and a wine bar, on Friday from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., Saturday from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. and Sunday from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. in the Altman Building, 135 West 18th Street. Admission is free: (888) 374-2869.
Home-Grown Goodness

On Monday from 6 to 9 p.m. a program about promoting local and organic agriculture will be held at the Vinegar Factory, 431 East 91st Street. Tickets for the event, sponsored by Les Dames d'Escoffier and benefiting the organization's scholarship fund, are $20 for members, $25 for nonmembers: (212) 867-3929.
A Guide to Game

D'Artagnan, the game and foie gras purveyor, is sponsoring a guided tasting of duck products from 6:30 to 9 p.m. on Monday, and of different kinds of game on Tuesday, both with wine, to benefit the American Institute of Wine and Food, at the French Culinary Institute, 462 Broadway (Grand Street). Tickets are $40 for members, $50 for nonmembers: (212) 447-0456.
Slicing and Dicing
A class in knife skills will be held on Oct. 25 at 7 p.m., at Chef Central, 240 Route 17 North, Paramus, N.J. There is no charge, and reservations are not necessary.
